title: running-chartlbi
text: vigenette work package must installed exist R’s default libpath. commented lines need uncommented first time either run whole document cell.
code: # installed_packages <- rownames(installed.packages()) # if (!'chartlbi' %in% installed_packages) { #   devtools::install_github("https://github.com/d2gex/chartlbi", dep=TRUE) # } # Ensure knitr does run the vignette from the same folder as interactively knitr::opts_knit$set(root.dir = dirname(getwd())) library("chartlbi")

title: running-chartlbi
text: vigenette assumes sitting root folder project. otherwise situations please use setwd suits best.

title: running-chartlbi
text: Length-frequency [weight--length] (https://github.com/ices-tools-dev/LBI_shiny/blob/master/data/walGad.csv) matrices gadoids example provided ICES.
code: length_freq_matrix <- readRDS("vignettes/data/demersal_fish_sample.rds") head(length_freq_matrix) #>   MeanLength X2004 X2005 X2006 X2007 X2008 X2009 X2010 X2011 X2012 X2013 X2014 #> 1       10.5     1     0     1     0     1     0     1     1     1     1     1 #> 2       11.5     1     0     1     0     1     0     1     1     1     1     1 #> 3       12.5     1     0     1     0     1     0     1     1     1     1     1 #> 4       13.5     1     0     1     0    26     0     1     1     1     1     1 #> 5       14.5     1     0     1     0    26     0     1     1     1     1     1 #> 6       15.5     0     0     1     0    26     1     1     1     1     1     1 #>   X2015 X2016 #> 1     0     1 #> 2     0     1 #> 3     0     1 #> 4     0     1 #> 5     0     1 #> 6     0     1 # (1) Define biological inputs and size of class length params <- AlgoParams$new() params$binwidth <- 10 params$linf <- 49.1 params$l50 <- 23  # (2) Define the context used to graph the results. Default values provided at # instantiation time. stack_plot_context <- PlotContext$new()  # (3) Define the threshold over which the LBI indicators will be evaluated. Default values provided at instantiation time. thresholds <- Thresholds$new()  # (5) Define indicator order you want them to be shown as column_order <- list('Pmega','Lc_Lmat', 'L25_Lmat', 'Lmax5_Linf', 'Lmean_Lopt', 'Lmean_Lfem')  # (4) Run the LBI algorithm lbi <- LbiAlgo$new(length_freq_matrix, params) results <- lbi$run()  # (5) Plot the results lbi_plotter <- OutputPlotter$new(results, stack_plot_context, thresholds) graph <- lbi_plotter$build_plots(column_order) graph

title: Authors and Citation
text: G D (2024). chartlbi: Enhance existing LBI data-poor method provided ICES https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ices-tools-dev/LBI_shiny/master/utilities.R. R package version 1.0, https://d2gex.github.io/chartlbi/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {chartlbi: Enhance existing LBI data-poor method provided by ICES at https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ices-tools-dev/LBI_shiny/master/utilities.R},   author = {Dan G},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0},   url = {https://d2gex.github.io/chartlbi/}, }

title: Agorithm Parameter class — AlgoParams
text: class holds parameters upon assigning, values biological parameters LBI algorithm requres

title: Agorithm Parameter class — AlgoParams
text: Initialise biological parameter class. Parameters self-explanatory.

title: LBI Algorithm Class — LbiAlgo
text: dataframe calculated indicators. modified dataframe holding calculated indicators.

title: LBI Algorithm Class — LbiAlgo
text: data length-frequency dataframe params R6 object named List biological parameters binwidth

title: LBI Algorithm Class — LbiAlgo
text: Wrap call actual LBI algorithm function

title: LBI Algorithm Class — LbiAlgo
text: method can called isolation get exact dataframe original LBI function returns. However, method modified weight--length matrix never used therefore Lmaxy Lmaxy/Lopt ratio longer available.

title: Class plotting LBI results — OutputPlotter
text: Results plotted tower plots, one top another

title: Class plotting LBI results — OutputPlotter
text: ggplot class ggplot class list built plots tower plots aligned

title: Class plotting LBI results — OutputPlotter
text: data dataframe LBI indicators plot_context R6 object named List parameteres allow customising certain aspects plot thresholds name list thresholds LBI indicators copmared

title: Plot's context details class — PlotContext
text: class holds aspects shape final plot visualising results LBI algorithm.

title: Plot's context details class — PlotContext
text: Initialise PlotContext class. Default values input parameters enough graph results first time.

title: Plot's context details class — PlotContext
code: PlotContext$new(   main_title_size = 15,   main_title = "LBI Scores",   threshold_line_width = 1.2,   x_title_size = 18,   x_text_size = 12,   x_text_angle = 90,   y_title_size = 18,   y_text_size = 12,   y_text_angle = 0 )

title: Thresholds class — Thresholds
text: class holds thresholds LBI indicators measured.

title: Thresholds class — Thresholds
text: Initialise Threshold class. Default values input parameters provided existing literature

title: Thresholds class — Thresholds
code: Thresholds$new(   Lc_Lmat = 1,   L25_Lmat = 1,   Lmax5_Linf = 0.8,   Pmega = 0.3,   Lmean_Lopt = 0.9,   Lmean_Lfem = 1 )

title: Calculate the wanted LBI indicators — lb_ind_pretty
text: Generate matrix calculated LBI indicators can compared thresholds. modified version 'lb_ind_ices' allow use weight--length matrix needed calculate 'Optimal Yield' maximum length holds largest biomass. reason two bugs follows: ) multiplication frequency weight--length matrices performed way year columns picked multiplied two matrices - columns shifted - b) multiple length classes may biomass yielding returned dimension error. Given bugs fact affected indicator - Lmaxy/Lopt- ued traffic-light visualisation form -lb_table-, indicator longer calculated version function.
